snippet: Malcolm Shabazz, the grandson of Malcolm X, died in Mexico City on Thursday night after spending much of his life seeking to make peace with his own past and that of his famous family.
abstract: Malcolm Shabazz, grandson of Malcolm X, dies in Mexico City after being assaulted outside bar; Shabazz, who earned notoriety at 12-years-old after setting fire that killed his grandmother, spent much of his life trying to make peace with his past and come to grips with his famous heritage.

byline.original: By KIA GREGORY and DAMIEN CAVE
byline.contributor: Kia Gregory reported from New York, and Damien Cave from Mexico City. Karla Zabludovsky contributed reporting from Mexico City. Sheelagh McNeill contributed research.

lead_paragraph: Malcolm Shabazz, the grandson of Malcolm X, died in Mexico City on Thursday night after spending much of his life seeking to make peace with his own past and that of his famous family.

headline.main: Troubled Life in Malcolm X’s Shadow Comes to a Violent End
headline.print_headline: Troubled Life in Malcolm X’s Shadow Comes to a Violent End
